customer_name: Wildlife Images Rehabilitation and Education Center

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There are several bottles of expired medications intermingled with non-expired medications intended for administration to
animals as needed: Tylosin injection (expired 09/2022), methyl-prednisolone (expired 04/2025), oxytetracycline (expired
12/2023), enrofloxacin tablets (expired 12/2023), celecoxib capsules (expired 05/2023), buspirone tablets (expired
02/2025), diphenhydramine liquid (expired 12/2022), metoclopramide liquid (expired 09/2024), dorzolamide ophthalmic
solution (expired 09/2023), buprenorphine injectable (expired 09/2024), butorphanol injectable (expired 2024), Atopica
(expired 10/2024), atipamezole (expired 2024), etomidate intravenous injectable (expired 11/2024 and 03/2023), Adequan
injectable solution (expired 08/2025). There is a bag of pre-filled 1 ml syringes labeled as cefazoline 100 mg/ ml but with
no labeling to indicate the expiration date. The gas anesthesia isoflurane vaporizer was last serviced in 12/2022 and has
not been serviced since its due date in 2023.
The use of expired medications, medications with an unknown expiration date, as well as use of unmaintained equipment
is not considered to be a safe or appropriate method to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries
because expired drugs or faulty equipment may be ineffective or produce other undesired effects. Animals may
experience discomfort or distress due to unrelieved symptoms or unexpected side effects from the use of expired
medication, and anesthetic reversal may not be effective when needed. The program for providing adequate veterinary
care shall include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. This
includes following established procedures to ensure expired medications are removed and cannot be administered to
animals.
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THE DATE OF THIS INSPECTION ON 11/18/2025 AND GOING FORWARD
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There are several bottles of expired medications intermingled with non-expired medications intended for administration to 
animals as needed: Tylosin injection (expired 09/2022), methyl-prednisolone (expired 04/2025), oxytetracycline (expired 
12/2023), enrofloxacin tablets (expired 12/2023), celecoxib capsules (expired 05/2023), buspirone tablets (expired 
02/2025), diphenhydramine liquid (expired 12/2022), metoclopramide liquid (expired 09/2024), dorzolamide ophthalmic 
solution (expired 09/2023), buprenorphine injectable (expired 09/2024), butorphanol injectable (expired 2024), Atopica 
(expired 10/2024), atipamezole (expired 2024), etomidate intravenous injectable (expired 11/2024 and 03/2023), Adequan 
injectable solution (expired 08/2025). There is a bag of pre-filled 1 ml syringes labeled as cefazoline 100 mg/ ml but with 
no labeling to indicate the expiration date. The gas anesthesia isoflurane vaporizer was last serviced in 12/2022 and has 
not been serviced since its due date in 2023.  
The use of expired medications, medications with an unknown expiration date, as well as use of unmaintained equipment 
is not considered to be a safe or appropriate method to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries 
because expired drugs or faulty equipment may be ineffective or produce other undesired effects. Animals may 
experience discomfort or distress due to unrelieved symptoms or unexpected side effects from the use of expired 
medication, and anesthetic reversal may not be effective when needed. The program for providing adequate veterinary 
care shall include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. This 
includes following established procedures to ensure expired medications are removed and cannot be administered to 
animals. 
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THE DATE OF THIS INSPECTION ON 11/18/2025 AND GOING FORWARD 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section

species.common: BARN OWL / WESTERN BARN OWL / AMERICAN BARN OWL / EASTERN BARN OWL
